The name "keepdims" is a violation of PEP-8's naming convention [https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#method-names-and-instance-variables], thus a violation of TensorFlow's style guide

Method Names and Instance Variables

Use the function naming rules: lowercase with words separated by underscores as necessary to improve readability.

Now one has to write code in inconsistent style like

tf.reduce UNDERSCORE max(..., keep NO_UNDERSCORE dims=True)

to avoid a deprecation warning.

Given that keep_dims had been the majority in TF's code base, wouldn't also accepting keepdims (while issuing a warning to suggest "keep_dims" instead) be a better solution?

body:
The name "keepdims" is a violation of PEP-8's naming convention [https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#method-names-and-instance-variables], thus a violation of TensorFlow's style guide

> Method Names and Instance Variables
>
> Use the function naming rules: lowercase with words separated by underscores as necessary to improve readability. 

Now one has to write code in inconsistent style like

```
tf.reduce UNDERSCORE max(..., keep NO_UNDERSCORE dims=True)
```

to avoid a deprecation warning.

Given that keep_dims had been the majority in TF's code base, wouldn't also accepting keepdims (while issuing a warning to suggest "keep_dims" instead) be a better solution?
